Class SpinTransport

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.apps.physics.spintronics.SpinTransport
public class SpinTransport extends Object
Advanced Spin Transport and Spin Transfer Torque (STT) calculations.

This class implements the Landau-Lifshitz-Gilbert (LLG) equation augmented with Spin Transfer Torque (STT) and stochastic thermal noise terms.

The LLG-STT Equation

$$ \frac{d\mathbf{m}}{dt} = -\gamma \mathbf{m} \times \mathbf{H}_{eff} + \alpha \mathbf{m} \times \frac{d\mathbf{m}}{dt} + \mathbf{\tau}_{STT} $$

References

  • Slonczewski, J. C. (1996). "Current-driven excitation of magnetic multilayers". Journal of Magnetism and Magnetic Materials, 159(1-2), L1-L7. DOI: 10.1016/0304-8853(96)00062-5
  • Berger, L. (1996). "Emission of spin waves by a magnetic multilayer traversed by a current". Physical Review B, 54(13), 9353. DOI: 10.1103/PhysRevB.54.9353
  • Brown, W. F. (1963). "Thermal Fluctuations of a Single-Domain Particle". Physical Review, 130(5), 1677. DOI: 10.1103/PhysRev.130.1677
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Method Details

    • calculateSTT

      public static Real[] calculateSTT(Real currentDensity, FerromagneticLayer layerFree, FerromagneticLayer layerPinned)
      Calculates the adiabatic Spin Transfer Torque (STT) vector. $$ \tau_{STT} = \frac{\hbar}{2e} \eta J (\mathbf{m}_{free} \times (\mathbf{m}_{fixed} \times \mathbf{m}_{free})) $$
      Parameters:
      currentDensity - Current density J (A/m²)
      layerFree - Free layer
      layerPinned - Pinned layer
      Returns:
      Torque vector components (N/m³ or equivalent units depending on normalization)

    • calculateSOT

      public static Real[] calculateSOT(FerromagneticLayer layer, Real j_c, Real theta_sh)
      Calculates the Spin-Orbit Torque (SOT) vector. Includes Damping-like torque (T_DL) and Field-like torque (T_FL). $$ \tau_{SOT} = \tau_{DL} [\mathbf{m} \times (\mathbf{\sigma} \times \mathbf{m})] + \tau_{FL} [\mathbf{m} \times \mathbf{\sigma}] $$ where \sigma is the spin polarization vector from SHE.
      Parameters:
      layer - The layer receiving SOT
      j_c - Current density in heavy metal (A/m2)
      theta_sh - Spin Hall Angle
      Returns:
      Torque vector components

    • spinAccumulation

      public static Real spinAccumulation(Real currentDensity, SpintronicMaterial material)
      Spin accumulation at the interface. $$ \Delta\mu = 2 P \rho \lambda_{sf} J $$

    • stepLLGWithThermalNoise

      public static Real[] stepLLGWithThermalNoise(FerromagneticLayer layer, Real[] hEff, Real dt, Real alpha, Real gamma, Real temperature, Real volume, Real ms)
      Calculates a single time step of magnetodynamics using the Stochastic Landau-Lifshitz-Gilbert equation. Includes thermal fluctuations (Brownian motion of the magnetization vector).
      Parameters:
      layer - The ferromagnetic layer to update
      hEff - The deterministic effective field (Anisotropy + Zeeman + Demag)
      dt - Time step (s)
      alpha - Gilbert damping parameter (dimensionless)
      gamma - Gyromagnetic ratio (rad/s/T)
      temperature - Temperature (K) for noise calculation
      volume - Volume of the magnetic element (m³)
      ms - Saturation magnetization (A/m)
      Returns:
      The new normalized magnetization vector M(t+dt)

    • stepLLG

      public static Real[] stepLLG(FerromagneticLayer layer, Real[] hEff, Real dt, Real alpha, Real gamma)
      Backward compatibility wrapper

    • stepLLGHeun

      public static Real[] stepLLGHeun(FerromagneticLayer layer, Real[] hEff, Real dt, Real alpha, Real gamma)
      Heun (RK2) integration for improved stability. Predictor-Corrector scheme: more accurate than Euler, especially for oscillatory dynamics.
